page.title: 04SLIMBRIDGE CHURCH
page.content: Although there have been claims that an Abbot built a church on this site around 900 A.D. most of the present church of Saint John the Evangelist was built between 1215 and 1300. Later additions include a spire, a new roof and the clerestory. Among the interesting architectural features are a sixteenth century sundial, two corbells showing Elizabeth 1st and a famous Abbot. The nave is one of the most beautiful in the country. There are sixteen excellent corbells on the south aisle dating from 1450, beside this is a thirteenth century piscina. A handsome spire was added to the church in 1664, also there is a very beautiful window covering the east wall.
